description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans) Amend the roof shape from mono pitch roof into dual pitch roof. Amend the floor height. seeking to change of the approved roof profile and fenestration of planning permission 241668FUL dated 27/08/2024 for: Construction of top floor extension to rear to use as office; external alterations to the north elevation involving the installation of a new roller shutter plus 2 new pedestrian entrance doors inside the shutters; subdivision of existing warehouse into 2 units and associated internal alterations.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission No. 241668FUL, i.e. 27/08/2024.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):

0161-EX-00 Revision A (Existing Location Plan); 0161-EX-20 Revision C (Existing Elevations); 0161-EX-10 Rev C (Existing Floor Plans); 0161-PR-00 Revision E1 (Proposed Location Plan); 0161-PR-10 Revision E1 (Proposed Floor Plans); 0161-PR-20 Revision E1 (Proposed Elevation)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| The proposed extension to accommodate additional office space, shall remain ancillary and connected to the main industrial use of the premises and shall not be subdivided to create a separate planning unit.
Reason: To protect the integrity of the Locally Significant Industrial Site and to prevent the introduction of non-conforming uses, in accordance with Policy E6 of the London Plan.
| All external materials to be used in the development hereby approved shall be as per those described in the submitted application form and plans listed in Condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

| Prior to use, shutters shall be installed with proprietary anti-vibration isolators to prevent structural or airborne vibration noise being transmitted to noise sensitive premises and the closing mechanism shall be buffered to adequately silence the operation of the shutters.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration or noise, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).
